HITCHCOCK HOUSE, POOL - DAY As Alma plunges into the water wearing her striking new swimsuit. She breaks into a front crawl. Her strokes are vigorous, surprisingly so. She drives the length of the pool, her arms slashing through the water with increasing speed, her feet kicking out with rising intensity... harder and harder... faster and faster...

direction.raw_text: I want to double check the print.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine, darling. I'll save you a seat. Lew escorts Alma and Peggy into the auditorium.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The soothing whir of the projector as Hitchcock stands next to it... but the sound of the audience below TITTERING NERVOUSLY is anything but reassuring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (under his breath) But they're laughing too much. He peers down through the tiny window but can't see a bloody thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hitch inches open the door and PEERS THROUGH THE CRACK at the audience but now he can't read them. Are they gripped with suspense -- or do they just hate it? From the lobby we see
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he closes the door and leans back against the wall of the empty corridor. A scared, lonely, corpulent figure. Totally powerless. There's nothing for him to do but wait. And wait. And wait. Across the foyer, a spotty young THEATRE EMPLOYEE sweeps up ticket stubs and empties ashtrays, quietly going about his business, entirely oblivious...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he grips the railing. This is taking far too long. And then -- finally -- the sweetest sound in the world A BLOOD-CURDLING SCREAM. Soon the WHOLE AUDIENCE SCREAMS IN TERROR... then breaks into
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: again... nervous laughter this time, the best kind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he gestures with his hands, a conductor leading his orchestra, raising them up again as the audience STARTS SCREAMING AGAIN right on cue
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the dam breaks and all the pent-up emotion floods out... leaving only relief and satisfaction... and making way for a smile... the largest of his whole career.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hitch, Alma and Peggy are led out into the foyer by the theatre manager. There are still SCREAMS in the theatre as the show continues. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lew can be seen on the phone in the theatre manager's office in the background as Hitch, Alma and Peggy walk past the line of ticket buyers to get to the front doors. There is great excitement now as more and more people recognize the Hitchcocks...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Hitchcock, how does it end?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promised Mother I wouldn't tell. He gets a laugh. Hitchcock walks alongside the Theater Manager who's not going to miss out on having his own moment with the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Hitchcock, what do I do now that my wife won't take a shower after seeing your movie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have her dry-cleaned. Laughter as Lew appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just got off the phone with Balaban. I couldn't resist telling him we're sold out for the next two weeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did he say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said "Tell Hitch congratulations. A well deserved triumph as we always knew."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "As we always knew..." The two friends a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does this mean I can take the weekend off now? Hitch playfully shrugs, "we'll see".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Mr. Hithcock but there are photographers outside. They heard you were here. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The theatre manager ushers them towards the exit doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few photographers snap Hitch as he emerges and heads past the line of ticket buyers towards the waiting car. Hitchcock gestures for Alma to take her place next to him instead of behind him. She shyly waves him away but eventually, and appreciatively, relents. As the flashbulbs start to POP -- ALMA This could be the biggest hit of your career, Alfred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our career, Alma. He looks into her eyes with nothing but deep, intense gratitude and joy. As more flashbulbs pop -- ALFRED HITCHCOCK (CONT'D) I've realized I'll never be able to find a Hitchcock blonde as beautiful as you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do realize I've been waiting decades to hear you say that. He gives her a gentle peck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that, madame, is why they call me "The Master of Suspense"... He helps her into the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a utilitarian institutionalized dining room. Several nonviolent INMATES eat at different round tables around the room. An ATTENDANT watches, and an ORDERLY mops the floor (there are NO female patients nor staff members.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CONTINUED: is at a table with two other patients, including a soft spoken older man, CHET. Ed is heavier, his hair is whiter, and he is much more at ease than we've ever seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the Attendant) Guess what I'm doing this weekend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudine and I are driving to Chicago with her folks to see that Psycho movie. The Attendant pulls the orderly aside, and whispers to him, nodding toward Ed. The Orderly's jaw drops! It is the coolest thing he's ever heard. He looks at Ed like he's a movie star. Meanwhile, Ed yawns, content. Utterly oblivious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you're the happiest guy I've ever known, Ed. How you do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you. You live your life, and it's unbearable sometimes but there's this secret, Chet; a big secret no one else knows or wants to tell... (he leans a little closer) ... there is a God and he's so big and powerful, he doesn't always remember you're there... He takes a huge bite blueberry pie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... but if you can get his attention and he sees you're suffering, he'll notice and he'll take care of you. My mother used to tell me -- she's passed, God bless her -- the one thing God truly loves and understands is suffering. He takes a long drink of milk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After all, he invented it. We pan to discover HITCHCOCK has been watching all this. He turns to the camera. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And so, gentle viewer, Psycho -- the picture everyone predicted would bring me to wrack and ruin -- was such a hit that Alma and I got to... Well, let's just say that we got to keep our house -- and the swimming pool. And the same critics who despised it went on to call it one of my greatest achievements. He produces a CIGAR and wanders towards the exit doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course for me, it was just another "moo-vie." As he strolls through the door -- EXT. HITCHCOCK HOUSE, GARDEN - DAY -- and seamlessly appears in the beautifully tended gardens, as if having walked through a portal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you know what they say in Hollywood: "You're only as good as your last picture." So, now, if you'll excuse me, I must toddle off to begin the exhaustive search for my next project. He holds out his cigar towards something we don't yet see...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unfortunately I find myself once again bereft of all inspiration. I do hope something comes along soon...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alights on his cigar tip and FLAPS its wings. Hitchcock can't resist blowing a sadistic plume of smoke at the bird which promptly flies away. He gives the camera a final characteristically deadpan look...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good evening. The distinctive THEME TUNE to his TV show starts up and Hitch toddles back up the front lawn and toward the terrace, where Alma can be seen laying out a delicious healthy lunch...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: HE DIED AT HOME IN BEL AIR IN 1980, WITH ALMA BY HIS SIDE

result.ToD: ALMA HITCHCOCK DIED TWO YEARS LATER
